{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3503439,"name":"","username":"wildmustang4903","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/wildmustang4903/{size}/263428_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-05T21:58:53.832Z","cooked":"

Hi folks,

We are getting our elevator running and trying to to sort out the best way to get fast, smooth operation with 2025 technology.

We have:

Two Neos running on 10:1 Versaplanetary gearboxes.

SparkMax controllers

Using the internal Neo encoder for feedback

Programming in C++

Currently using the wpilib PID controller. Have motion but requires tuning still.

What is the best solution for this or what are other people doing? Implementing feed forward? Trapezoidal or other motion profiles? Using the SparkMax PID?

What is today’s preferred method.

Thanks

You’ll want to review this page in the WPILib docs.

PID and Feedforward work great. You’ll probably also want to include motion profiling, limiting your acceleration values for smoother motion.

If you’re using sparkmaxes, I recommend running the PID on the controller. It makes it respond much faster, which makes for better control.

docs.revrobotics.com

Closed Loop Control | REVLib

We are using the thrifty 2 stage elevator here is our code:

package frc.robot.subsystems;

import com.revrobotics.spark.SparkClosedLoopController;
import com.revrobotics.spark.SparkFlex;
import com.revrobotics.spark.SparkMax;
import com.revrobotics.spark.SparkBase.ControlType;
import com.revrobotics.spark.SparkLowLevel.MotorType;
import com.revrobotics.spark.config.SparkFlexConfig;
import com.revrobotics.spark.config.SparkMaxConfig;

import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase;

public class ArmSubsystem extends SubsystemBase {

  private SparkFlex elevatorVortex;
  private SparkClosedLoopController elevatorVortexController;
